newsitem.title: TUNISIA: Tunis bourse ends slightly lower in thin trade.
newsitem.headline: Tunis bourse ends slightly lower in thin trade.

text.p: The Tunis Stock Exchange index on Tuesday closed 0.62 percent lower in thin trade, bourse sources said.
The 31-share index closed at 500.26 points, down from 503.37 on Monday.
Total volume was 375,217 dinars against 584,739 dinars over the previous session.
Investment fund Tuninvest-SICAF fell one dinar to 12.6 dinars on its first day of trading on the computerised dealing system with 4,632 shares changing hands.
Banque de Tunisie dropped 1.5 dinars to 74 dinars. Retail stores Monoprix fell 1.1 dinar to 37.4. Investment fund SPDIT-SICAF was down 0.7 dinar to 17.8 dinars. Amen Bank slid 0.48 dinar to 37.02.

Chemical firm Al-Kimia edged 0.3 dinar lower to 50.7 dinars after it announced that it will distribute a 3.445 dinars dividend and super dividend per share of a nominal 10 dinars, lower than 4.035 dinars distributed last year.
Household firm Ateliers Mecaniques du Sahel declined 0.21 dinar to 12.99.
